newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: NWE oil products drawn down by weaker futures.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products drawn down by weaker futures.

text.p: NWE oil products weakened on Tuesday morning as futures dipped following the Easter break, dealers said.
Gasoline offers began $1 a tonne lower at $203 fob Rotterdam for Eurograde, but one barge traded as low as $200 fob late in the morning.
Dealers said the market was likely to weaken with little evidence of buyers and arbitrage to the United States barely workable except with the largest of cargoes.
Heating oil barges were slightly softer as IPE futures dipped and physical offers came down 50 cents.
Prompt material was offered at IPE April +50 cents, with bids at +50 cents. Buying remained thin.
High sulphur fuel oil also softened. Two barges traded at $85 and $86 fob ARA, down $1/$2. Initial bunker enquiry volume was low.
